DI-001.name: Address Line 1
DI-001.rule: A component of a metering point site address. There are defined parts of the address for each address line.

DI-002.name: Address Line 2
DI-002.rule: A component of a metering point site address

DI-003.name: Address Line 3
DI-003.rule: A component of a metering point site address

DI-004.name: Address Line 4
DI-004.rule: A component of a metering point site address

DI-005.name: Address Line 5
DI-005.rule: A component of a metering point site address

DI-006.name: Address Line 6
DI-006.rule: A component of a metering point site address

DI-007.name: Address Line 7
DI-007.rule: A component of a metering point site address

DI-008.name: Address Line 8
DI-008.rule: A component of a metering point site address

DI-009.name: Address Line 9
DI-009.rule: A component of a metering point site address

DI-010.name: Metering Point Postcode
DI-010.rule: The full postcode of the metering point site.

DI-015.name: Connection Type Indicator
DI-015.rule: A code to indicate the type of connection at the metering point.
DI-015.populationNotes:
- W  Whole Current
- L  LV with CT
- H  HV with CT
- E  EHV with CT
- U  Unmetered

DI-016.name: Connection Type Effective From Date
DI-016.rule: The date and time from which the metering point Connection Type is in effect.

DI-017.name: Consent Granularity
DI-017.rule: Describes the granularity of energy settlement data that a customer has deemed to have consented to.
DI-017.populationNotes:
- H Half Hourly Consent Granted
- D Daily Consent Granted
- M Monthly Reads Only
- N No Consent

DI-018.name: Consent Granularity Effective From Date
DI-018.rule: The date from which the consent granularity was in effect.

DI-019.name: Contract Reference Metering Service
DI-019.rule: The unique reference of the contractual agreement between a supplier and the Metering Service.

DI-020.name: Contract Reference Data Service
DI-020.rule: The unique reference of the contractual agreement between a supplier and the data service.

DI-021.name: Customer Direct Contract Metering Service
DI-021.rule: An indicator to show if a direct customer contract exists between the customer and the Metering Service provider.

DI-022.name: Customer Direct Contract Data Service
DI-022.rule: An indicator to show if a direct customer contract exists between the customer and Data Service provider.

DI-023.name: Data Service Effective From Date
DI-023.rule: The Date from which the Data Service was Appointed

DI-025.name: DCC Service Flag
DI-025.rule: A DCC provided flag to indicate the status of the services being provided by the DCC to a Metering Point.
DI-025.populationNotes:
- A Active
- I Installed Not Commissioned
- N Non-Active

DI-026.name: DCC Effective From Date (DCCF)
DI-026.rule: The first inclusive calendar date for which the status of the DCC Service flag applies.

DI-027.name: Disconnection Effective From Date
DI-027.rule: The date on which the connection point is physically removed from the metering system.

DI-028.name: Reconnection Effective From Date
DI-028.rule: The date on which the connection point is physically reconnected to the metering system.

DI-029.name: Distributor ID
DI-029.rule: The market-wide unique reference for the distributor who is responsible for the distribution network that a metering point is connected to.

DI-030.name: Domestic Premise Indicator
DI-030.rule: A flag that indicates if the MPAN of the registration appointment is used to identify a domestic premise.

DI-031.name: Load Shape Domestic Premise Indicator
DI-031.rule: The Domectic Premise Indicator associated with a Load Shape

DI-032.name: Domestic Premise Indicator Effective From Date
DI-032.rule: The date from which the metering point Domestic Premise Indicator is in effect.

DI-033.name: Energisation Status
DI-033.rule: Indicates if the metering point is considered energised (i.e. connected to the distribution system) and therefore active for settlement purposes.

DI-034.name: Energisation Status Effective From Date
DI-034.rule: The settlement date and time from which an energisation status is in effect for a metering system.

DI-035.name: Energy Direction
DI-035.rule: Indicates the direction of energy at a metering point. Values can be I = import / E = export.

DI-036.name: GSP Group ID EffectiveFrom Date
DI-036.rule: The date and time from which the GSP Group ID is in effect for the metering system.

DI-037.name: GSP Group ID
DI-037.rule: Identifies the distinct grid supply point group (physical region of the country) where the metering point is located.

DI-038.name: Associated Import/Export MPAN
DI-038.rule: When this metering point is part of an import/export pair, this identifies the related import or export metering point. Where more than one import MPAN exists, this shall be populated with the Primary Import MPAN.

DI-039.name: Load Shape GSP Group ID
DI-039.rule: The GSP Group ID associated with a Load Shape

DI-040.name: Annual Load Shape Total
DI-040.rule: Annual consumption associated with a particular Load Shape

DI-041.name: Load Shape 7 Day Rolling Off-peak Total
DI-041.rule: The sum of the 7 day rolling Off-Peak total (kWh) using the Off-Peak total for the UTC date plus the last 6 UTC dates

DI-042.name: Load Shape 7 Day Rolling Peak Total
DI-042.rule: The sum of the 7 day rolling Peak total (kWh) using the Peak total for the UTC date plus the last 6 UTC dates

DI-043.name: Load Shape 7 Day Rolling Total
DI-043.rule: The sum of the 7 day rolling total (kWh) using the total for the UTC date plus the previous 6 UTC dates

DI-044.name: Load Shape Day Off-Peak Total
DI-044.rule: The sum of Period Values for settlement periods (kWh) (1 to 14) or (2 to 15). UTC times Midnight -7pm

DI-045.name: Load Shape Day Peak Total
DI-045.rule: The sum of Period Values (kWh) for settlement periods (15 to 48) or (1 and 16 to 48). UTC times 7pm - Midnight

DI-046.name: Load Shape Day Total
DI-046.rule: The sum of all Period Values for the UTC Date.

DI-048.name: Manufacturers Make and Type
DI-048.rule: The manufacturer's make name and type number of a Meter

DI-050.name: Market Segment Indicator
DI-050.populationNotes:
- S Smart/Traditional
- A Advanced
- U Unmetered

DI-051.name: Market Segment Indicator Effective From Date
DI-051.rule: The date from which the metering point Market Segment is in effect.

DI-052.name: Measurement Quantity ID
DI-052.rule: Identifies the type of the quantity that is measured by the UTC Period Consumption Value.
DI-052.populationNotes:
- AI Active import
- AE Active export
- RI Reactive import
- RE Reactive export

DI-053.name: Meter ID (Removed)
DI-053.rule: Serial number of the removed physical meter.

DI-054.name: Meter Asset Provider Effective From Date
DI-054.rule: The inclusive calendar date from which the meter asset provider is in effect for the metering system.

DI-055.name: Meter Asset Provider ID
DI-055.rule: The market-wide reference for the provider of the meter equipment.

DI-056.name: Meter ID
DI-056.rule: Serial number of the physical meter.

DI-057.name: Meter Installation Date/Time
DI-057.rule: The date of installation for a meter at a metering point.

DI-058.name: Meter Removal Date/time
DI-058.rule: The date when the meter was removed from a metering point.

DI-059.name: Meter Type
DI-059.rule: The type of meter, in relation to its capabilities. E.g. AMR.S1, S2, S2ADE

DI-060.name: Modified Meter ID
DI-060.rule: Updated/ Corrected Serial number of the physical meter.

DI-061.name: Metering Service Effective From Date
DI-061.rule: The Date from which the Metering Service was Appointed

DI-063.name: MPAN Core
DI-063.rule: A business key used to uniquely identify the metering point that is the subject of the update.

DI-073.name: Principal MPAN
DI-073.rule: The Principal MPAN in a Related/Linked MPAN Relationship

DI-074.name: Subsidiary MPAN
DI-074.rule: The subsidiary MPAN in a Related/Linked MPAN Relationship

DI-075.name: Primary MPAN
DI-075.rule: The primary in a related MPAN relationship. The primary is associated with the base load settlement configuration (contains no value, if not part of related MPAN pair).

DI-076.name: Estimation Reason Code {e}
DI-076.rule: Reason why Data Service had to provide Estimated/Zero Data
DI-076.populationNotes:
- 1 Opt Out
- 2 Missing
- 3 Invalid
- 4 Comms Fault
- 5 LTV
- 6 Disabled
- 7 De-Energised
- 8 Disconnected
- 9 Consumption Amendment
- 10 Non-Smart

DI-077.name: CSS RMP Deactivation Date
DI-077.rule: The Date on which the CSS considers the MPAN to have been deactivated / terminated.

DI-079.name: Secondary MPAN
DI-079.rule: The secondary in a related MPAN relationship.

DI-081.name: Settlement Period Duration
DI-081.rule: The settlement period duration in minutes.

DI-082.name: Settlement Period Effective To Date/Time
DI-082.rule: The UTC end date and time of the settlement period for a consumption value.

DI-083.name: Settlement Period Quality Indicator {q}
DI-083.rule: Describes if the UTC Period Consumption Value is an actual or what estimation method was used to estimate it.
DI-083.populationNotes:
- A Actual
- E Estimate (UMS Only)
- A1, A2, A3, AAE1, AAE2, AAE3, EAE1, EAE2, EAE3 (ADV Only)
- E0 --> E9 Estimation Method 1 - 9
- EA1-->EA13 ADS Estimation Methods
- ZE De-Energised (for use with Unmetered Supplies only)
- ZE1--> ZE3 Zero Estimation Method 1 -3

DI-085.name: Electricity Smart Meter Equipment (ESME ID)
DI-085.rule: The Electricity Smart Meter Equipment GUID is the unique identifier for a Smart electricity This is also known as the DCC GUID and is further defined within the DCC interface specifications.

DI-086.name: Supplier Effective From Date
DI-086.rule: The date and time from which a supplier came into effect, with regard to their relationship with the metering point.

DI-088.name: Cumulative Register Reading
DI-088.rule: The value of the Cumulative meter register at a specified date and time.

DI-089.name: Cumulative Register Reading Date / Time
DI-089.rule: The date and time [in UTC] of the Cumulative Register Meter Read.

DI-090.name: Meter Location
DI-090.rule: The actual location of the metering system within the site
DI-090.populationNotes:
- A Attic
- B Bedroom
- C Cellar/Basement
- D Other not specified
- E Indoors
- F Not known
- G Garage/Greenhouse
- H Hall
- I Cupboard
- J Intake
- K Kitchen
- L Landing
- M Sub Station
- N TC Chamber
- O Outbuilding Barn
- P Pole
- R Ladder required
- S Understairs
- T Toilet
- U Upstairs
- V Vestry
- W Under Window
- X Outside Box
- Y O/S Box with restricted access
- Z Communal Cupboard

DI-091.name: Number of Displayed Register Digits
DI-091.rule: The number of digits prior to the decimal point displayed by the total cumulative register of a smart meter

DI-092.name: Nature of Maintenance
DI-092.rule: Details of the tests, maintenance and replacement work done by the Meter Operator on the meters, communications equipment and links in a Metering System.

DI-093.name: Additional Information
DI-093.rule: A free format character string for providing additional details.

DI-094.name: Reading Method
DI-094.rule: Indicates how the Cumulative meter reading was obtained/derived
DI-094.populationNotes:
- A Actual Data Recovered from Meter
- C Customer
- E Estimate by SDS
- S Estimate by Supplier
- X Derived Reading (Based on Actual)
- Y Derived Reading (Based on Estimate)

DI-096.name: Site Visit Check Code
DI-096.rule: A code identifying either nature of checks made/to be made on metering equipment during a site visit or identifying reason for failure to obtain readings.

DI-097.name: Failure to Energise/de-energise reason code
DI-097.rule: The reason why the Energisation or De-Energisation has not been carried out.

DI-098.name: Supplier Notification Expiry Date
DI-098.rule: The Date from which a Supper Notification [to DS] Expires

DI-099.name: Configurable Register Reading Date /Time
DI-099.rule: The date and time [in UTC] of a Configurable Register Meter Read. This should be considered to be midnight where an exact time is unavailible

DI-100.name: Supplier Notification Effective From Date
DI-100.rule: The Date from which a Supper Notification [to DS] becomes Effective From

DI-101.name: UTC Settlement Date
DI-101.rule: UTC Date for which data applies

DI-102.name: Load Shape Period Value
DI-102.rule: Consumption Value (kWh) for the UTC Period Duration within a Load Shape.

DI-103.name: Configurable Register ID
DI-103.rule: Register ID relating to a specific configurable (billing) register on a Smart/Advanced Meter

DI-104.name: Configurable Register Reading
DI-104.rule: Reading associated to a specific Register ID on a Smart/Advanced Meter

DI-108.name: Distributor DIP ID
DI-108.rule: The DIP ID of the distributor who is responsible for the distribution network that a metering point is connected to.

DI-109.name: Distributor DIP EZ Name
DI-109.rule: The DIP EZ Name of the distributor who is responsible for the distribution network that a metering point is connected to.

DI-111.name: Green Deal Effective From Date
DI-111.rule: The date from which a Green Deal agreement is considered to be in place.

DI-112.name: Green Deal Effective To Date
DI-112.rule: The date to which a Green Deal agreement is considered to be in place.

DI-120.name: Additional Information
DI-120.rule: A free format character string for providing additional details.

DI-121.name: Outgoing Supplier Effective To Date
DI-121.rule: The last inclusive settlement date after which a Supplier's registration to a metering system ceases to be valid.

DI-122.name: Profile Class
DI-122.rule: A legacy classification, maintined by Suppliers, retained soley to assist with the undertsanding of allocation of gross consumption to individual Settlement Periods.

DI-123.name: SSC
DI-123.rule: A legacy classification, maintined by Suppliers, retained soley to assist with the undertsanding of allocation of gross consumption to individual Settlement Periods.

DI-124.name: Profile Class Effective From Date
DI-124.rule: The Date from which the current Profile Class became Effective

DI-125.name: SSC Effective From Date
DI-125.rule: The Date from which the current Profile Class became Effective

DI-126.name: Traditional / Fall Back Read Frequency
DI-126.rule: Supplier requested Traditional / Fall Back Meter Reading Frequency
DI-126.populationNotes: - F Fortnightly, - W Weekly, - M Monthly, - Q Quarterly, - S Six Monthly, - A Annually

DI-127.name: Metered Indicator
DI-127.rule: An indicator to show whether the Consumption Component is for a metered supply or unmetered supply.
DI-127.populationNotes: - False = U - Unmetered, - True = M - Metered

DI-128.name: DUOS Tariff ID
DI-128.rule: Reference to identify the DUoS Tariff assigned to an MPAN

DI-129.name: DUOS Tariff ID EffectiveFrom Date
DI-129.rule: Date on which DUoS Tariff came into effect

DI-130.name: RMP Status (Registration)
DI-130.rule: The MPAN RMP Status as held in the Registration Service
DI-130.populationNotes:
- C Created
- O Operational
- T Terminated

DI-131.name: MP Status
DI-131.rule: The MP or Trading Status as held in the Registration Service
DI-131.populationNotes:
- N New
- R Registered
- T Traded
- X Disconnected

DI-134.name: SMSO
DI-134.rule: The Id of the operator a Supplier has procured data and communication services from in respect of a Metering System (applies only to certain types of SMETS1 Metering).

DI-135.name: SMSO Status Effective From Date
DI-135.rule: The first inclusive calendar date that a Smart Metering System Operator ID is the provider of communications services to a Metering System (applies only to certain types of SMETS1 Metering).

DI-136.name: IHD Status Effective From Date
DI-136.rule: The first inclusive calendar date that an a notable IHD status was provided.

DI-137.name: IHD Install Status
DI-137.rule: Information regarding the In Home Display at a metering point.
DI-137.populationNotes:
- I Installed
- D Declined
- E Existing
- F Failed

DI-138.name: Customer Direct Contract Data Service DIP ID
DI-138.rule: The DIP ID of the Data Service that has recorded the existence of a Customer Direct Contract for that MPAN.

DI-140.name: Customer Direct Contract Metering Service DIP ID
DI-140.rule: The DIP ID of the Metering Service that has recorded the existence of a Customer Direct Contract for that MPAN.

DI-143.name: Proposed Appointment Response Code
DI-143.rule: A code which defines the Appointment Request Outcome.

DI-145.name: Customer Direct Contract Metering Service EffectiveTo Date
DI-145.rule: Date on which Customer Direct Contract Metering Service Ends

DI-146.name: Customer Direct Contract Data Service EffectiveTo Date
DI-146.rule: Date on which Customer Direct Contract Data Service Ends

DI-147.name: UTC Period Consumption Value {v}
DI-147.rule: Consumption Value (kWh/kVARh) for the UTC Period Duration.

DI-149.name: Annual Consumption EffectiveFrom Date
DI-149.rule: Date on which Assumed Annual Consumption was Calculated/is Effective From

DI-150.name: Annual Consumption Quality Indicator
DI-150.populationNotes: - A 100% Actual data, - 1  > 75% Actual data, - 2  <75% Actual data, - 3  100% Estimated data, - 4  > 50% no data, - 5  < 50% no data, - D Default

DI-151.name: Linked MPAN Energy Direction
DI-151.rule: Energy Direction of the Linked MPANs

DI-152.name: Supplier Nominated Annual Consumption
DI-152.rule: Supplier Nominated Annual Consumption Value, to be used as required by Data Service in preference to the ECS calculated Annual Consumption

DI-153.name: UTC Period Consumption Value (Defaulted)
DI-153.rule: Consumption Value (kWh/kVARh) for the UTC Period Duration.

DI-154.name: Default Load Shape Flag
DI-154.rule: A flag to identify the period value is based on a default calculation.
DI-154.populationNotes: - 'A'  Actual, - 'D' – Default, - 'E' – Back Stop, - 'B' – No data available

DI-155.name: Settlement Impacted Data Service DIP ID
DI-155.rule: DIP ID of the Data Service appointed for Defaulted SP

DI-157.name: Settlement Impacted Supplier DIP ID
DI-157.rule: DIP ID of the Supplier Responsible for Defaulted SP

DI-159.name: Settlement Run Execution Date
DI-159.rule: Date/Time at which Settlement Run was Executed

DI-160.name: Settlement Code
DI-160.rule: A code which, together with the Settlement Date, identifies a Settlement published in the Settlement Timetable. It identifies the type of Settlement.
DI-160.populationNotes: - SF  Final Initial Settlement, - R1  First Reconciliation, - R2  Second Reconciliation (Transition), - R3  Third Reconciliation (Transition), - RF  Final Reconciliation, - DR  Dispute, - DF  Final Dispute

DI-161.name: Run Number
DI-161.rule: The identifier, unique within an Agent system, which identifies a run of that system.

DI-162.name: Consumption Amendment Supplier Reference
DI-162.rule: Supplier's Unique Reference Number for Consumption Amendment Request

DI-166.name: Supplier Consumption Amendment Reason Code
DI-166.populationNotes: - A Agreed Read, - E Estimation Issue, - M Metering Issue (Crossed/Missed Exchange/Found), - R Reading Issue (Transposed / Misread), - S Stolen/Lost Meter, - T Tampering/Theft, - X Other

DI-167.name: RMP Status Effective From Date
DI-167.rule: The Effective From Date of MPAN RMP Status as held in the Registration Service

DI-168.name: MP Status Effective From Date
DI-168.rule: The Effective From Date MP or Trading Status as held in the Registration Service

DI-192.name: GPF (Gas) GUID
DI-192.rule: Comms Hub Associated Gas GUID (if available)

DI-195.name: Comms Hub Activity
DI-195.populationNotes: - 1  Installation, - 2  Removal, - 3  Exchanged, - 4 Found (Found Asset or Initally installed by Gas Supplier), - 5  For Information

DI-196.name: MDR Request Reference Date
DI-196.rule: Reference Date for which data should be recovered from the meter

DI-206.name: Service Provider Appointment Requesting Supplier MPID
DI-206.rule: Service Provider Appointment Requesting Supplier MPID

DI-300.name: Consumption Component Class ID
DI-300.rule: Valid values are in the range 100 --> 999

DI-500.name: MHHS Regime End Date
DI-500.rule: The last Settlement Date which MPAN will be subject to MHHS Settlement Regime.

DI-501.name: Reverse Migration Incoming MOP MPID
DI-501.rule: MPID for the next/incoming MOP following Reverse Migration

DI-502.name: Reverse Migration Incoming MOP Effective From Date
DI-502.rule: The Date from which MOP appointment is/was effective following Reverse Migration

DI-503.name: Reverse Migration Incoming DC MPID
DI-503.rule: MPID for the next/incoming DC following Reverse Migration

DI-504.name: Reverse Migration Incoming DC Effective From Date
DI-504.rule: The Date from which DC appointment is/was effective following Reverse Migration

DI-510.name: Off Peak Declaration Date
DI-510.rule: Settlement Day to which OPD should be applied

DI-511.name: Off Peak Declaration Proportion
DI-511.rule: Proportion (%) of consumption to be considered as Off-Peak

DI-800.name: Service Provider Appointment Scenario
DI-800.rule: Code used to identify the scenario around Service Provider Appointment
DI-800.populationNotes: - COS (Change of Supplier), - CSP (Change of SP), - USP (Update existing SP Appointment), - SEG (Change of Segment), - MCA (Migration Change of Agent), - MCS (Migration Change of Supplier), - ALG (Auto Alignment of MPAN Service Providers)

DI-801.name: Import/Export MPAN Supplier DIP ID
DI-801.rule: DIP ID of the Supplier Responsible for the Linked MPAN

DI-803.name: Incoming Supplier DIP ID
DI-803.rule: The market-wide unique reference for a supplier that is responsible for the settlement liabilities.

DI-805.name: Outgoing Supplier DIP ID
DI-805.rule: The market-wide unique reference for a supplier that is responsible for the settlement liabilities.

DI-807.name: Incumbent Metering Service DIP ID
DI-807.rule: This is the Metering Service with responsibility for an MPAN at the point a Proposed Appointment Request is 'Accepted' by a Prospective Metering Service. This party is responsible for providing the Prospective MS with MTDs for Traditional and Advanced Meters.

DI-809.name: Current Metering Service DIP ID
DI-809.rule: DIP ID of the Metering Service Appointed at the point message was created by the Registration Service, i.e. the Currently Appointed Metering Service

DI-811.name: Current Data Service DIP ID
DI-811.rule: DIP ID of the Data Service Appointed at the point message was created by the Registration Service, i.e. the Currently Appointed Data Service

DI-813.name: De-Appointed Metering Service DIP ID
DI-813.rule: DIP ID for the Metering Service subject to De-Appointment

DI-815.name: Metering Service Effective To Date
DI-815.rule: The Date at which the Metering Service is De-Appointed.

DI-816.name: De-Appointed Data Service DIP ID
DI-816.rule: DIP ID for the Data Service subject to De-Appointment

DI-818.name: Data Service Effective To Date
DI-818.rule: The Date at which the Data Service is De-Appointed.

DI-819.name: De-Appointment Reason Code
DI-819.rule: A code indicating reason for termination of Service Provider Appointment
DI-819.populationNotes: - CSUPP Change of Supplier, - CSERV  Change of Service Provider, - DEREG  RMP Terminated by CSS, - CSEGM  Change of Segment, - CCONN  Change of Connection Type, - IMPEXP  Linked MPAN, - RELATED Related MPAN

DI-822.name: Incoming Metering Service DIP ID
DI-822.rule: DIP ID for the next/incoming Metering Service

DI-824.name: Incoming MS EffectiveFrom Date
DI-824.rule: The Date from which next/incoming Metering Service appointment is/was effective

DI-825.name: Incoming Data Service DIP ID
DI-825.rule: DIP ID for the next/incoming Data Service

DI-827.name: Incoming Data Service Effective From Date
DI-827.rule: Incoming (Next) Data Service Effective From Date

DI-828.name: Proposed Metering Service DIP ID
DI-828.rule: DIP ID of Metering Service supplier proposes should be appointed to an MPAN

DI-830.name: Proposed MS EffectiveFrom Date
DI-830.rule: Date at which Supplier would like proposed Metering Service appointment to take effect

DI-831.name: Proposed Data Service DIP ID
DI-831.rule: DIP ID of Data Service supplier proposes should be appointed to an MPAN

DI-833.name: Proposed DS Effective From Date
DI-833.rule: Date at which Supplier would like proposed Data Service appointment to take effect

DI-834.name: Supplier Nominated MDR DIP ID
DI-834.rule: The market-wide unique reference for a specific Meter Data Retriever (MDR)

DI-836.name: Supplier Nominated MDR Effective From Date
DI-836.rule: Date from which Supplier would like Nominated MDR to apply

DI-837.name: Supplier Proposed Domestic Premise Indicator
DI-837.rule: Supplier proposed DPI for a SP Appointment

DI-838.name: Supplier Proposed Consent Granularity
DI-838.rule: Supplier proposed Consent Granularity for a SP Appointment
DI-838.populationNotes: - H Half Hourly Consent Granted, - D Daily Consent Granted, - M Monthly Reads Only, - N No Consent

DI-839.name: SDS Nominated MDR DIP ID
DI-839.rule: DIP ID of the MDR the SDS has requested to be assigned to an MPAN

DI-841.name: SDS Nominated MDR Effective From Date
DI-841.rule: Date from which Supplier would like Nominated MDR to apply

DI-842.name: Assigned MDR DIP ID
DI-842.rule: DIP ID of the MDR assigned to an MPAN

DI-844.name: Assigned MDR EffectiveFrom Date
DI-844.rule: The Effective Date from which the MDR Effective Date to be recorded as in Registration and DCC

DI-845.name: Issuing Data Service DIP ID
DI-845.rule: DIP ID of the Data Service submitting the data

DI-847.name: Service Provider App Requesting Supplier DIP ID
DI-847.rule: DIP of Supplier making the Service Appointment Request

DI-849.name: CSS Registration ID
DI-849.rule: The CSS identifier associated with a Supplier's Registration

DI-850.name: MDR Effective To Date
DI-850.rule: The Date at which the MDR stops collecting data.

DI-965.name: Distribution Variant Description
DI-965.example: ISD tables that Suppliers want only

DI-966.name: Distribution Variant Version ID
DI-966.rule: Version Number of the Distribution Variant

DI-967.name: Distribution Variant Issued Date
DI-967.rule: Publication Date of the Distribution Variant

DI-968.name: Distribution Variant Format
DI-968.rule: File Type of the Distribution Variant Components (e.g. JSON/CSV/PDF File)

DI-979.name: Response Code
DI-979.rule: Code used to identify the outcome of the Event Request
DI-979.populationNotes: - A  Accepted - R  Rejected - L  Lapsed - W Warning

DI-980.name: Response Message
DI-980.rule: Message describing the status/outcome of the previous originating transaction

DI-992.name: Schema Version
DI-992.rule: The Scheme Version against which the message has been constructed

DI-999.name: Event Code
DI-999.rule: Code used to identify the nature of the Event

REG0000.description: MPAN Invalid or does not exist.
REG0000.reason: The MPAN Core provided in the request does not exist in the Registration Service or fails the standard checksum validation.
REG0000.resolution: Verify the MPAN Core is correct and has 13 digits. Check the MPAN against a trusted source before resubmitting the interface.

REG0001.description: Data Block 'Removed Meter' cannot be used with Event [MeterInstall]
REG0001.reason: The request is for a meter installation but incorrectly includes data for a meter removal.
REG0001.resolution: Remove the 'Removed Meter' data block (B039) from the interface payload and resubmit.

REG0002.description: Data Block 'Installed/Updated Meter' cannot be used with [MeterRemoved]

REG0003.description: Event/Operation cannot be undertaken when Connection Type is Unmetered

REG0004.description: Event/Operation cannot be undertaken when Mk. Segment is Unmetered

REG0005.description: CSS Registration Request ID is invalid or does not exist
REG0005.resolution: Ensure the CSS Registration Request ID is valid and associated with an active switch for the sending supplier.

REG0006.description: CSS Registration Request ID is associated to another Supplier
REG0006.resolution: Verify that the Sender ID matches the Supplier ID associated with the CSS Registration Request ID.

REG0007.description: Cannot manage MPAN Relationship during a Switch
REG0007.resolution: To resolve this, ensure that mpan is not subject to an active switch. Please check your data and resubmit.

REG0008.description: Amendment Requested cannot be undertaken by Previous Metering Service
REG0008.resolution:
To resolve this, ensure that metering service [s0.senderid] holds valid previous appointment then [system date] should be <= [reg.app end date] + 10 working days -- restrict updates to meter location only... 
reject if msg 1.it includes b034 block, 2.it includes b039 block, 3.it includes b030 block, 4.modified meter id is populated, 5.meter type doesnâ€™t match existing meter type, 6.meter manufacturer doesnâ€™t match existing meter manufacturer 7.esme id doesnâ€™t match existing esme id 8.number of displayed register digits doesnâ€™t match current number of displayed register digits 9.meter installation date doesnâ€™t match current meter installation date. Please check your data and resubmit.

REG0009.description: Null Value cannot be set as Value held is already Null
REG0009.resolution: Do not attempt to set a value to null if the existing value is already null. Check the data item (e.g., SMSO, IHD Status, SSC, or Profile Class) before sending the update.

REG1001.resolution: Ensure the MPAN's RMP status is either 'Created' or 'Operational' before proceeding.

REG1002.description: No Valid Appointment held by Metering Service on Relevant Date
REG1002.resolution: To resolve this, ensure that sending metering service id [so.senderid] is currently appointed or held a valid appointment for meter installation date [di-057]. Please check your data and resubmit.

REG1003.description: Post Appointment Update Period has Expired
REG1003.resolution: To resolve this, ensure that metering service [s0.senderid] holds valid previous appointment then [system date] should be <= [reg.app end date] + 10 working days. Please check your data and resubmit.

REG1004.description: Meter ID does not match existing Installed Meter(s)
REG1004.resolution: To resolve this, ensure that removed meter id [di-056] matches an existing installed meter id. Please check your data and resubmit.

REG1005.description: Meter Removal Date cannot be prior to Install Date
REG1005.resolution: To resolve this, ensure that for meter id [di-053], meter removal date [di-058] >= existing meter installed date [registrationdata]. Please check your data and resubmit.

REG1006.description: Meter with same Meter ID already Installed
REG1006.resolution: To resolve this, ensure that meter id (di-056) matches an existing installed meter id (in registration) for mpan [di-063]. Please check your data and resubmit.

REG1007.description: Meter Install Date must be prior to Disconnection Date
REG1007.resolution: To resolve this, ensure that install date [di-057] < disconnection effective date (in registration). Please check your data and resubmit.

REG1008.description: Meter Install Date cannot be prior to Removal Date for Exchange
REG1008.resolution: To resolve this, ensure that install date [di-057] >= remove date [di-058] for meterid [di-053]. Please check your data and resubmit.

REG1009.resolution: To resolve this, ensure that map ip [di-055] is valid in isd for map effective date [di-054]. Please check your data and resubmit.

REG1010.description: MAP Effective Date cannot be prior to Meter Install Date
REG1010.resolution: To resolve this, ensure that map effective date [di-054] <> meter install date [di-057]. Please check your data and resubmit.

REG1011.description: Meter Install Date cannot be Prior to MPAN Creation Date
REG1011.resolution: To resolve this, ensure that install date (di-057)  >= mpan creation date (registration). Please check your data and resubmit.

REG1012.description: Only Appointed MS can use Update Events
REG1012.resolution: To resolve this, ensure that sending metering service id [so.senderid] is currently appointed. Please check your data and resubmit.

REG1013.description: Modified Meter ID already exists as an Installed Meter ID for MPAN
REG1013.resolution: To resolve this, ensure that modified meter id [di-060] matches an existing installed meter id (in registration for mpan [di-063]. Please check your data and resubmit.

REG1014.resolution: To resolve this, ensure that number of b034 groups > 1. Please check your data and resubmit.

REG1015.description: Meter ID does not exist so cannot be updated
REG1015.resolution: To resolve this, ensure that installed meterid [di-056] <> a currently installed /active meter id for mpan. Please check your data and resubmit.

REG1016.description: Install & Remove Meter ID's should match for Event
REG1016.resolution: To resolve this, ensure that removed block exists with install/update block  and  removed meter id [di-053] <> meter id [di-056]. Please check your data and resubmit.

REG1017.description: Meter ID and Meter Install/Removed Date cannot be updated in the same transaction
REG1017.resolution: To resolve this, ensure that [di-60] is not null and (meter install date [di-057] <>  {reg.installdate} for meter [di-59] and/or meter removal date [di-058] <> {reg.removedate} for meter [di-059] (noting that removal date could be null)). Please check your data and resubmit.

REG1018.description: Cannot use [MeterHistoryUpdate] to amend installed meter
REG1018.resolution: To resolve this, ensure that installed meterid (di-056 i) =  existing meter id in registration currently installed for mpan. Please check your data and resubmit.

REG1019.description: Event should be within Requesting Parties period of Responsibility
REG1019.resolution: Ensure the effective from date for the event (e.g., Consent Granularity, SMSO, IHD, SSC, or Profile Class) is within the supplier's period of ownership and not before the Supplier Start Date (SSD).

REG1020.description: Event cannot take place in the future
REG1020.resolution: The effective from date for this event cannot be set for a future date. Please adjust the date and resubmit.

REG1021.description: Requesting Supplier is not the Current Supplier
REG1021.resolution: This action can only be performed by the current supplier for the MPAN. Please verify the sender is the currently appointed supplier.

REG1022.description: Proposed Data Item Value is invalid
REG1022.resolution: The proposed value is invalid for the MPAN's current configuration. Check that the combination of Consent Granularity, Domestic Premises Indicator, Energy Direction, and Market Segment is valid.

REG1023.resolution: Verify that the provided SMSO ID is a valid identifier for the specified effective date.

REG1024.resolution: The effective from date cannot be set more than 5 days in the past. Please adjust the date and resubmit.

REG1025.description: Scenario USP can only be used with currently appointed Service Provider
REG1025.resolution: When using the 'USP' scenario, the service provider in the request must be the one currently appointed.

REG1026.description: Scenario CSP cannot propose the currenly appointed Service Provider
REG1026.resolution: When using the 'CSP' scenario, you must propose a new service provider, not the one that is currently appointed.

REG1027.description: Metering Service is not currently appointed and does not hold a Prospective SEG Appointment
REG1027.resolution: To resolve this, ensure that metering service [so.sender] is the currently appointed metering service or ms [so.sender] does have a proposed ms app with scenario "seg" in the appointment queue. Please check your data and resubmit.

REG1028.description: Meter Install/Removal Date Cannot be Null
REG1028.resolution: To resolve this, ensure that install date [di-057] should not be null / blank. Please check your data and resubmit.

REG1029.description: Modified Meter Id Must be Null
REG1029.resolution: To resolve this, ensure that [di-060] revised meter id should be null. Please check your data and resubmit.

REG1030.description: Metering Service not valid for Unmetered site in LDSO
REG1030.resolution: Ensure the specified Metering Service is a valid Unmetered Supplies Operator (UMSO) for the given LDSO.

REG1031.description: Service Provider incompatible with MPAN Market Segment
REG1031.resolution: The selected Service Provider (Metering or Data Service) is not compatible with the MPAN's current market segment. Please check the provider's valid segments and resubmit.

REG1032.description: Service Provider EffectiveFrom Date is not Contiguous / or is Invalid
REG1032.resolution: The Service Provider Effective From Date is invalid. Ensure the date is equivalent to midnight local time and is contiguous with the previous appointment or Supplier Start Date.

REG1033.resolution: The Appointment Scenario ID is not valid because the sender is not the currently appointed supplier for a 'USP' or 'CSP' scenario.

REG1034.description: Prospective Appointment cannot be in the past
REG1034.resolution: For a prospective appointment made by a non-current supplier, the appointment date cannot be in the past. Please provide a current or future date.

REG1036.description: MDR EffectiveFrom Date must be within Suppliers Ownership
REG1036.resolution: The Proposed MDR Effective From Date must not be earlier than the Data Service Appointment date or the previous MDR's effective date.

REG1038.description: Appointments barred on Linked Export MPAN
REG1038.resolution: Service appointments cannot be made on a linked Export MPAN. Please use the associated Import MPAN for this request.

REG1039.description: Appointments barred on Related Secondary MPAN
REG1039.resolution: Service appointments are barred on a secondary MPAN in a related group. Please direct the request to the primary MPAN.

REG1040.description: SSD Effective From Date must be later than existing
REG1040.resolution: The effective from date for the SSC or Profile Class must be later than the most recent effective from date already on record.

REG1041.description: Profile Class Effective From Date must be later than existing
REG1041.resolution: The Profile Class effective from date must be greater than the latest Profile Class effective date on record.

REG1042.description: SSC Cannot be set to Null when installed Meter Type is Group Trad
REG1042.resolution: You cannot set the Standard Settlement Configuration (SSC) to null when the installed meter type is 'Group Traditional'.

REG1043.description: PC Cannot be set to Null when installed Meter Type in Group Trad
REG1043.resolution: You cannot set the Profile Class (PC) to null when the installed meter type is 'Group Traditional'.

REG1044.description: SSC must be a valid value in ISD
REG1044.resolution: The provided Standard Settlement Configuration (SSC) code is not a valid value. Please check against the Industry Standing Data (ISD) and resubmit.

REG1045.description: PC must be a valid value in ISD
REG1045.resolution: The provided Profile Class (PC) is not a valid value. Please check against the Industry Standing Data (ISD) and resubmit.

REG1046.resolution: To resolve this, ensure that [di-085] esme id must not be populated if [di-059] meter type does not match 'smart meter group' in isd. Please check your data and resubmit.

REG1047.resolution: To resolve this, ensure that [di-091] number of displayed register digits should be populated if [di-059] meter type matches 'smart meter group' in isd. Please check your data and resubmit.

REG1048.resolution: To resolve this, ensure that [di-090] meter location value provided is invalid. Please check your data and resubmit.

REG1049.description: Value provided for data item is not consistent with ISD
REG1049.resolution: To resolve this, ensure that [di-059] meter type does not exist in isd. Please check your data and resubmit.

REG1050.description: Supplier must have ownership of either Import/Export MPAN to maintain Relationships

REG1051.description: Unmetered MPANs cannot be part of an MPAN Relationship

REG1052.description: MPAN(s) already part of an Import/Export Relationship

REG1053.description: Proposed Principal MPAN in Import/Export Relationship must be Import

REG1054.description: Proposed Subsidiary MPAN(s) in Import/Export Relationship must be Export

REG1055.description: Proposed Principal MPAN [DI-075] is not currently part of an Import/Export Relationship

REG1056.description: Proposed Subsidiary MPAN(s) is a member of a separate Import/Export Relationship

REG1057.description: Proposed Subsididary MPAN(s) is already in a Relationship with the Proposed Principle

REG1058.description: Proposed Subsidiary MPAN is not currently part of an Import/Export Relationship

REG1059.description: MPAN(s) cannot be duplicated within same message

REG1060.description: Supplier must have ownership of All MPANs to maintain Relationships

REG1061.description: Proposed MPAN(s) are already part of a Related MPAN Relationship

REG1062.description: Proposed Principal MPAN is not the Primary MPAN in an existing Relationship

REG1063.description: Proposed Subsidiary MPAN is already in an MPAN Relationship with Primary MPAN

REG1064.description: Proposed Secondary MPAN is already part of a different MPAN Relationship

REG1065.description: Proposed Subsidiary MPAN(s) not in a Related Relationship with Principal MPAN Referenced

REG1067.description: Only Import MPANs can become Related

REG1071.description: CDC Effective Date cannot be Retrospective
REG1071.resolution: To resolve this, ensure that cdc effective from date [di-843] > sysdate. Please check your data and resubmit.

REG1072.description: CDC End Date Extends Beyond Maximum Allowed
REG1072.resolution: To resolve this, ensure that cdc end date [di-844] < cdc effective from date + 2 years. Please check your data and resubmit.

REG1073.description: CDC Already Exists for the Period Requested
REG1073.resolution: To resolve this, ensure that cdc start date [di-843] > [reg.cdc_effective_to_date]. Please check your data and resubmit.

REG1074.description: CDC End Date cannot be prior to Start Date
REG1074.resolution: To resolve this, ensure that cdc effective to date [di-146] > cdc effective from date [di-843]. Please check your data and resubmit.

REG1075.description: Proposed Metering Service ID does not exist in the ISD Catalogue
REG1075.reason: The DIP ID for the proposed Metering Service is not a valid ID listed in the Industry Standing Data (ISD) catalogue.
REG1075.resolution: Verify the Metering Service DIP ID and ensure it is a valid ID from the ISD catalogue before resubmitting.

REG1076.description: Proposed Data Service ID does not exist in the ISD Catalogue
REG1076.reason: The DIP ID for the proposed Data Service is not a valid ID listed in the Industry Standing Data (ISD) catalogue.
REG1076.resolution: Verify the Data Service DIP ID and ensure it is a valid ID from the ISD catalogue before resubmitting.

REG1077.description: Proposed MDR ID does not exist in the ISD Catalogue
REG1077.reason: The DIP ID for the proposed Meter Data Retriever (MDR) is not a valid ID listed in the Industry Standing Data (ISD) catalogue.
REG1077.resolution: Verify the MDR DIP ID and ensure it is a valid ID from the ISD catalogue before resubmitting.

REG1078.description: Supplier ID does not exist in the ISD Catalogue
REG1078.reason: The Supplier ID provided in the message is not a valid ID listed in the Industry Standing Data (ISD) catalogue.
REG1078.resolution: Verify the Supplier ID and ensure it is a valid ID from the ISD catalogue before resubmitting.

REG1079.description: Distributor ID does not exist in the ISD Catalogue
REG1079.reason: The Distributor ID provided in the message is not a valid ID listed in the Industry Standing Data (ISD) catalogue.
REG1079.resolution: Verify the Distributor ID and ensure it is a valid ID from the ISD catalogue before resubmitting.

REG1080.description: Nominated MDR not a valid MDR for this Data Service
REG1080.reason: The MDR nominated by the Data Service is not a valid MDR within that Data Service's portfolio. Each Data Service can only nominate MDRs that are compatible and supported by them.
REG1080.resolution: Verify that the nominated MDR is one that is supported by the specified Data Service. Check the ISD or the Data Service's documentation for a list of compatible MDRs.

REG1081.description: Assigned MDR not a valid MDR for this Data Service
REG1081.reason: The MDR assigned by the DCC is not a valid MDR within the Data Service's portfolio.
REG1081.resolution: Verify the assigned MDR is supported by the Data Service.

REG1082.description: The MDR End Date must not be in the future
REG1082.reason: MDR appointments can only be ended on the current date or a date in the past. Future-dated terminations are not allowed.
REG1082.resolution: Adjust the MDR End Date to be the current date or a date that has already passed. Resubmit the request.

REG1083.description: MDR End Date must be later than the MDR Effective From Date
REG1083.reason: The end date for the MDR appointment cannot be on or before its start date. The MDR must be active for at least one day.
REG1083.resolution: Ensure the MDR End Date is after the MDR Effective From Date. Correct the dates and resubmit the request.

REG1084.description: The Nominated MDR is not currently appointed to the MPAN
REG1084.reason: The supplier has nominated an MDR for de-appointment that is not the one currently appointed to the MPAN.
REG1084.resolution: Ensure the nominated MDR for de-appointment is the one currently active on the MPAN. Verify the current MDR's ID before resubmitting.

REG1085.description: The Nominated MDR is not the same as the one recorded by the DCC
REG1085.reason: The MDR nominated by the SDS is not the same as the one currently recorded as appointed in the DCC.
REG1085.resolution: Check the current MDR assigned to the MPAN in the DCC system and ensure the nominated MDR matches before resubmitting.

REG1086.description: The Nominated MDR Effective From Date is not within the Data Service's Appointment Period
REG1086.reason: The proposed effective date for the MDR appointment falls outside of the time period that the Data Service is appointed to the MPAN.
REG1086.resolution: Correct the MDR Effective From Date to fall within the Data Service's appointment period.

REG1087.description: The MDR Effective From Date is not Contiguous
REG1087.reason: The proposed MDR Effective From Date is not immediately following the previous MDR's End Date. There is a gap or an overlap in the appointment history.
REG1087.resolution: Adjust the MDR Effective From Date to be contiguous with the previous MDR's End Date.

REG1088.description: The MDR Effective From Date is earlier than the MDR Effective From Date on the previous MDR
REG1088.reason: The proposed MDR Effective From Date is chronologically before the effective date of the previous MDR appointment, which would create an invalid timeline.
REG1088.resolution: Ensure the MDR Effective From Date is after the previous MDR's Effective From Date.

REG1089.description: Metering Service DIP is not valid
REG1089.reason: The Metering Service DIP ID provided is not found in the Industry Standing Data (ISD) catalogue.
REG1089.resolution: Verify the Metering Service DIP ID against the ISD catalogue and correct the value before resubmitting.

REG1090.description: Data Service DIP is not valid
REG1090.reason: The Data Service DIP ID provided is not found in the Industry Standing Data (ISD) catalogue.
REG1090.resolution: Verify the Data Service DIP ID against the ISD catalogue and correct the value before resubmitting.

REG1091.reason: The Supplier ID provided is not found in the Industry Standing Data (ISD) catalogue.
REG1091.resolution: Verify the Supplier ID against the ISD catalogue and correct the value before resubmitting.

REG1092.reason: The Distributor ID provided is not found in the Industry Standing Data (ISD) catalogue.
REG1092.resolution: Verify the Distributor ID against the ISD catalogue and correct the value before resubmitting.

REG1093.description: Supplier Nominated MDR is not valid
REG1093.reason: The MDR nominated by the supplier is not a valid MDR in the ISD catalogue.
REG1093.resolution: Verify the nominated MDR ID against the ISD catalogue and correct the value before resubmitting.

REG1094.description: SDS Nominated MDR is not valid
REG1094.reason: The MDR nominated by the SDS is not a valid MDR in the ISD catalogue.
REG1094.resolution: Verify the nominated MDR ID against the ISD catalogue and correct the value before resubmitting.

REG1095.reason: The assigned MDR is not a valid MDR in the ISD catalogue.
REG1095.resolution: Verify the assigned MDR ID against the ISD catalogue and correct the value before resubmitting.

REG1096.description: The proposed MDR is already the appointed MDR for the MPAN
REG1096.reason: A request was made to appoint an MDR that is already the current MDR for the MPAN. This is a redundant and invalid action.
REG1096.resolution: Check the currently appointed MDR for the MPAN and ensure that the proposed MDR is different before making an appointment request.

REG1097.description: De-appointed MDR cannot be the same as the Proposed MDR
REG1097.reason: The MDR being de-appointed and the proposed new MDR are the same entity. An MDR cannot de-appoint itself to re-appoint itself in a single transaction.
REG1097.resolution: Ensure that the de-appointed MDR and the proposed MDR are different entities.

REG1098.description: The Metering Service and Data Service are not compatible
REG1098.reason: The combination of the proposed Metering Service and Data Service is not a valid or supported combination according to the ISD catalogue.
REG1098.resolution: Check the ISD catalogue for compatible combinations of Metering and Data Services for the specified MPAN. Adjust one or both of the service provider IDs to a compatible pair.

REG1099.description: Supplier cannot de-appoint a service provider that they did not appoint
REG1099.reason: The supplier sending the request is not the supplier who initially appointed the service provider being de-appointed.
REG1099.resolution: De-appointments can only be requested by the supplier who holds the current appointment. Verify that the correct supplier is making the request.

REG1100.description: The MPAN is not currently live on the DCC network
REG1100.reason: The MPAN for which the request is being made has not been activated or is not currently active on the DCC network.
REG1100.resolution: Ensure the MPAN is active and enrolled on the DCC network before making this request.

REG1101.description: The Metering Service cannot de-appoint itself
REG1101.reason: A Metering Service is attempting to de-appoint its own appointment. De-appointments must be initiated by an external party, such as a supplier.
REG1101.resolution: The de-appointment request must come from a third party (supplier). The Metering Service cannot self-de-appoint.

REG1102.description: The Data Service cannot de-appoint itself
REG1102.reason: A Data Service is attempting to de-appoint its own appointment. De-appointments must be initiated by an external party, such as a supplier.
REG1102.resolution: The de-appointment request must come from a third party (supplier). The Data Service cannot self-de-appoint.

REG1103.reason: The De-appointment Reason Code provided in the request is not a valid code in the ISD catalogue.
REG1103.resolution: Verify the De-appointment Reason Code against the ISD catalogue and provide a valid code before resubmitting.

REG1104.description: Appointment Scenario is invalid for this event
REG1104.reason: The appointment scenario provided (e.g., 'COS', 'CSP') is not a valid scenario for the type of event being requested.
REG1104.resolution: Check the documentation for the event to see which appointment scenarios are supported. Correct the scenario code and resubmit.

REG1105.description: The Supplier ID is invalid for the specified event
REG1105.reason: The supplier ID provided in the message is not valid for the action being requested. For example, a supplier ID for a 'change of supplier' event might be for a supplier that is not the current supplier.
REG1105.resolution: Verify the supplier ID against the business rules for the specific event and correct it as needed.

REG1106.description: The meter is not a smart meter
REG1106.reason: The request involves a smart meter-specific action, but the meter ID provided is not associated with a smart meter.
REG1106.resolution: Verify that the meter is a smart meter before making a smart meter-specific request. If the meter is not smart, this action is not permitted.

REG1107.description: Data item not applicable to this event
REG1107.reason: The message includes a data item that is not relevant or not permitted for the event being requested. This can happen if a data item from a different event type is included.
REG1107.resolution: Review the data items required for the specific event and remove any that are not applicable. Resubmit the message with only the required and optional data items.

REG1108.reason: The message composition is invalid. This could be due to missing a mandatory block, including a block that is conditionally mandatory when its condition is not met, or including an optional block that is not permitted for the event.
REG1108.resolution: Review the message composition rules for the event. Ensure that all mandatory blocks are included, all conditionally mandatory blocks are correctly used, and no prohibited optional blocks are present.

REG1109.description: Message composition has an invalid structure
REG1109.reason: The message composition is invalid due to a structural issue, such as a repeating block that is not permitted to repeat or a nested block that is not allowed.
REG1109.resolution: Check the message structure rules and adjust the composition to be valid. For example, if a block is not permitted to repeat, ensure it is only included once.

REG1110.reason: The GSP group ID provided is not a valid ID listed in the ISD catalogue.
REG1110.resolution: Verify the GSP group ID against the ISD catalogue and correct the value before resubmitting.

REG1111.reason: The market segment provided (e.g., 'Smart', 'Advanced') is not a valid market segment listed in the ISD catalogue.
REG1111.resolution: Verify the market segment against the ISD catalogue and correct the value before resubmitting.

REG1112.reason: The consent granularity provided is not a valid value for the event. This may occur if the selected granularity is not compatible with the meter type or market segment.
REG1112.resolution: Verify the consent granularity against the business rules and correct the value before resubmitting.

REG1113.reason: The domestic premise indicator provided ('T' for True or 'F' for False) is not a valid value for the event. This might be due to a conflict with the market segment or other data items.
REG1113.resolution: Verify the domestic premise indicator against the business rules and correct the value before resubmitting.

REG1114.reason: The energy direction provided ('I' for Import or 'E' for Export) is not a valid value for the event or is inconsistent with other data items.
REG1114.resolution: Verify the energy direction against the business rules and correct the value before resubmitting.

REG1115.reason: The meter type provided is not a valid meter type listed in the ISD catalogue.
REG1115.resolution: Verify the meter type against the ISD catalogue and correct the value before resubmitting.

REG1116.reason: The connection type indicator provided is not a valid value listed in the ISD catalogue.
REG1116.resolution: Verify the connection type indicator against the ISD catalogue and correct the value before resubmitting.

REG1117.reason: The Meter Asset Provider (MAP) ID provided is not a valid ID listed in the ISD catalogue.
REG1117.resolution: Verify the MAP ID against the ISD catalogue and correct the value before resubmitting.

REG1118.reason: The Smart Metering System Operator (SMSO) ID provided is not a valid ID listed in the ISD catalogue.
REG1118.resolution: Verify the SMSO ID against the ISD catalogue and correct the value before resubmitting.

REG1119.reason: The In-Home Display (IHD) install status provided is not a valid value listed in the ISD catalogue.
REG1119.resolution: Verify the IHD install status against the ISD catalogue and correct the value before resubmitting.

REG1120.reason: The RMP (Registration Metering Point) status provided is not a valid value listed in the ISD catalogue.
REG1120.resolution: Verify the RMP status against the ISD catalogue and correct the value before resubmitting.

REG1121.reason: The MP (Metering Point) status provided is not a valid value listed in the ISD catalogue.
REG1121.resolution: Verify the MP status against the ISD catalogue and correct the value before resubmitting.

REG1122.reason: The meter location code provided is not a valid value listed in the ISD catalogue.
REG1122.resolution: Verify the meter location code against the ISD catalogue and correct the value before resubmitting.

REG1123.reason: The de-appointment reason code provided is not a valid value listed in the ISD catalogue.
REG1123.resolution: Verify the de-appointment reason code against the ISD catalogue and correct the value before resubmitting.

REG1124.reason: The consumption component class ID provided is not a valid value listed in the ISD catalogue.
REG1124.resolution: Verify the consumption component class ID against the ISD catalogue and correct the value before resubmitting.

REG1125.reason: The settlement code provided is not a valid value listed in the ISD catalogue.
REG1125.resolution: Verify the settlement code against the ISD catalogue and correct the value before resubmitting.

REG1126.description: Invalid supplier consumption amendment reason code
REG1126.reason: The supplier consumption amendment reason code is not a valid value.
REG1126.resolution: Verify the supplier consumption amendment reason code and correct the value before resubmitting.

REG1127.reason: The consumption component indicator is not a valid value.
REG1127.resolution: Verify the consumption component indicator and correct the value before resubmitting.

REG1128.reason: The metered indicator is not a valid value.
REG1128.resolution: Verify the metered indicator and correct the value before resubmitting.

REG1129.reason: The traditional/fall back read frequency is not a valid value.
REG1129.resolution: Verify the traditional/fall back read frequency and correct the value before resubmitting.

REG1130.reason: The GSP group ID is not a valid value.
REG1130.resolution: Verify the GSP group ID and correct the value before resubmitting.

REG1131.description: Invalid load shape domestic premise indicator
REG1131.reason: The load shape domestic premise indicator is not a valid value.
REG1131.resolution: Verify the load shape domestic premise indicator and correct the value before resubmitting.

REG1132.description: Invalid load shape day off-peak total
REG1132.reason: The load shape day off-peak total is not a valid value.
REG1132.resolution: Verify the load shape day off-peak total and correct the value before resubmitting.

REG1133.description: Invalid load shape day peak total
REG1133.reason: The load shape day peak total is not a valid value.

interfaces.name: Supplier to Registration Service - Supplier Appointment Request
interfaces.context: Supplier sends a request to the Registration Service to appoint Service Providers to an MPAN. The request will include one of the following scenarios: Change of Supplier, Change of Service Provider, or Update Service Provider. The Supplier may also nominate a Meter Data Retriever (MDR) that they would like assigned to the MPAN.

composition.title: B003 - Outgoing Supplier (Conditionally Mandatory for COS)
B068 - MPAN Consent Info (Mandatory for COS)

interfaces.name: Registration Service to Supplier - Service Provider Appointment Outcome
interfaces.context: The Registration Service provides an outcome of a previous Service Provider Appointment Request initiated by a Supplier. This includes details of the appointment outcome and any applicable rejection codes.

interfaces.name: Registration Service to Outgoing Supplier - Supplier Change
interfaces.context: The Registration Service notifies the Outgoing Supplier that their appointment to an MPAN is to be de-registered. The de-registration will be made effective from the date provided in the message.

interfaces.name: Outgoing Supplier to Registration Service - Supplier Change Confirmation
interfaces.context: The Outgoing Supplier confirms that they acknowledge and accept the de-registration of their appointment from an MPAN as notified by the Registration Service.

interfaces.name: Registration Service to Incoming Supplier - Supplier Change
interfaces.context: The Registration Service notifies the Incoming Supplier that their appointment to an MPAN is to be registered. The registration will be made effective from the date provided in the message.

interfaces.name: Incoming Supplier to Registration Service - Supplier Change Confirmation
interfaces.context: The Incoming Supplier confirms that they acknowledge and accept the registration of their appointment to an MPAN as notified by the Registration Service.

interfaces.name: Supplier to Registration Service - Service Provider De-Appointment Request
interfaces.context: Supplier sends a request to the Registration Service to de-appoint a Metering Service or Data Service from an MPAN. The Supplier may also nominate a Meter Data Retriever (MDR) that they would like assigned to the MPAN. This message is used when the supplier's own appointment is not changing.

composition.title: B008 - Metering Service De-Appointment Details (Conditionally Mandatory)
B009 - Data Service De-Appointment Details (Conditionally Mandatory)

interfaces.name: Registration Service to De-Appointed MS - De-Appointment Notification
interfaces.context: The Registration Service notifies the de-appointed Metering Service that their appointment to an MPAN is to be de-registered. The de-registration will be made effective from the date provided in the message.

interfaces.name: De-Appointed MS to Registration Service - De-Appointment Confirmation
interfaces.context: The de-appointed Metering Service confirms that they acknowledge and accept the de-registration of their appointment from an MPAN as notified by the Registration Service.

interfaces.name: Registration Service to De-Appointed DS - De-Appointment Notification
interfaces.context: The Registration Service notifies the de-appointed Data Service that their appointment to an MPAN is to be de-registered. The de-registration will be made effective from the date provided in the message.

interfaces.name: De-Appointed DS to Registration Service - De-Appointment Confirmation
interfaces.context: The de-appointed Data Service confirms that they acknowledge and accept the de-registration of their appointment from an MPAN as notified by the Registration Service.

interfaces.name: Registration Service to Incoming MS - Service Provider Appointment Notification
interfaces.context: The Registration Service notifies the Incoming Metering Service that their appointment to an MPAN is to be registered. The registration will be made effective from the date provided in the message.

interfaces.name: Incoming MS to Registration Service - Service Provider Appointment Confirmation
interfaces.context: The Incoming Metering Service confirms that they acknowledge and accept the registration of their appointment to an MPAN as notified by the Registration Service.

interfaces.name: Registration Service to Incoming DS - Service Provider Appointment Notification
interfaces.context: The Registration Service notifies the Incoming Data Service that their appointment to an MPAN is to be registered. The registration will be made effective from the date provided in the message.

interfaces.name: Incoming DS to Registration Service - Service Provider Appointment Confirmation
interfaces.context: The Incoming Data Service confirms that they acknowledge and accept the registration of their appointment to an MPAN as notified by the Registration Service.

interfaces.name: Registration Service to Outgoing Supplier - Change to Supplier’s Service Providers
interfaces.context: The Registration Service notifies the Outgoing Supplier that the Metering or Data Service for an MPAN that they are responsible for has been de-appointed.

interfaces.name: Outgoing Supplier to Registration Service - Change to Supplier’s Service Providers Confirmation
interfaces.context: The Outgoing Supplier acknowledges and accepts the de-appointment of a Service Provider for an MPAN they are responsible for.

interfaces.name: Incoming MS to Outgoing MS - Partner Service Provider Notification
interfaces.context: The Incoming Metering Service notifies the Outgoing Metering Service that it has been appointed to an MPAN and will be providing services from the effective date. This is for information only.

interfaces.name: Incoming DS to Outgoing DS - Partner Service Provider Notification
interfaces.context: The Incoming Data Service notifies the Outgoing Data Service that it has been appointed to an MPAN and will be providing services from the effective date. This is for information only.

interfaces.name: Registration Service to Supplier - Supplier Service Provider Info Update
interfaces.context: The Registration Service provides the Supplier with updated information for an MPAN they are responsible for. This could include changes to Service Provider IDs, Meter IDs, etc.

interfaces.name: Registration Service to Incoming Supplier - Customer Direct Contract Info
interfaces.context: The Registration Service provides the Incoming Supplier with information about Customer Direct Contracts associated with a newly registered MPAN. This information is a confirmation of a direct contract between the customer and a Service Provider.

composition.title: B020 - Customer Direct Contract MS Info (Conditionally Mandatory)
B021 - Customer Direct Contract DS Info (Conditionally Mandatory)

interfaces.name: Supplier to Registration Service - Customer Direct Contract Update
interfaces.context: The Supplier provides the Registration Service with updated information about a Customer Direct Contract for an MPAN they are responsible for.

interfaces.name: Registration Service to Supplier - MPAN Status Update
interfaces.context: The Registration Service notifies the Supplier of a change in an MPAN's status. This could be due to energisation, de-energisation, or another event affecting the MPAN's live status.

composition.title: B079 - Meter Point Registration Statuses (Conditionally Mandatory)

interfaces.name: Supplier to Registration Service - Supplier Info Update
interfaces.context: The Supplier provides the Registration Service with an update to information for an MPAN they are responsible for. This could include changes to IHD status, SMSO, or legacy data.

interfaces.name: Registration Service to Supplier - Meter Status Update
interfaces.context: The Registration Service notifies the Supplier of a change in an MPAN's meter information. This could be due to a meter installation, exchange, or removal.

interfaces.name: Supplier to Registration Service - Meter Data Update
interfaces.context: The Supplier provides the Registration Service with updated meter-specific information for an MPAN they are responsible for. This could include a meter exchange, installation, or removal.

interfaces.name: Registration Service to Incumbent MS - Meter Data Update
interfaces.context: The Registration Service notifies the incumbent Metering Service of a change in an MPAN's meter information. This could include a meter exchange, installation, or removal.

composition.title: B074 - MPAN Existing Meter Info (Conditionally Mandatory)
B075 - Existing Meter MAP Info (Conditionally Mandatory)

interfaces.name: Registration Service to Supplier - Meter Energisation Status Notification
interfaces.context: The Registration Service provides the Supplier with a notification of the outcome of a Meter Energisation/De-Energisation attempt. This message also provides a reason why the action may not have been carried out.

interfaces.name: Registration Service to Supplier - Settlement Run Notification
interfaces.context: The Registration Service provides the Supplier with a notification of a newly executed settlement run. This notification will contain details about the settlement run.

interfaces.name: SDS to BSC - Settlement Data
interfaces.context: The SDS provides half-hourly data for a metering point to the BSC for settlement purposes. This data may be a combination of actual and estimated data.

composition.title: B048 - UTC Settlement Period Consumption Defaulted Data (Conditionally Mandatory)

interfaces.name: BSC to SDS - Settlement Data Acknowledgement
interfaces.context: The BSC acknowledges the receipt of settlement data from the SDS.

interfaces.name: SDS to Supplier - Settlement Data
interfaces.context: The SDS provides half-hourly settlement data to the Supplier for a metering point. This data may be a combination of actual and estimated data.

composition.title: B048 - UTC Settlement Period Consumption Defaulted Data (Conditionally Mandatory)

interfaces.name: Supplier to SDS - Settlement Data Acknowledgement
interfaces.context: The Supplier acknowledges the receipt of settlement data from the SDS.

interfaces.name: SDS to Supplier - Load Shape Data
interfaces.context: The SDS provides Load Shape data to the Supplier for an MPAN they are responsible for.

composition.title: B052 Load Shape Period Data (Conditionally Mandatory)
B054 Load Shape Annual Consumption (Conditionally Mandatory)
B053 Load Shape Total Data (Conditionally Mandatory)

interfaces.name: Supplier to SDS - Load Shape Data Acknowledgement
interfaces.context: The Supplier acknowledges the receipt of Load Shape data from the SDS.

interfaces.name: SDS to Supplier - Supplier Advisory Notification
interfaces.context: The SDS notifies the Supplier of a specific event or status that may require their attention, such as a metering issue or data discrepancy.

interfaces.name: Supplier to SDS - Supplier Advisory Notification Acknowledgement
interfaces.context: The Supplier acknowledges the receipt of a Supplier Advisory Notification from the SDS.

interfaces.name: Supplier to SDS - Supplier Nominated Annual Consumption
interfaces.context: The Supplier provides the SDS with a nominated Annual Consumption value for an MPAN. This value is used by the SDS for estimation and consumption calculations.

interfaces.name: SDS to Supplier - Supplier Nominated Annual Consumption Acknowledgement
interfaces.context: The SDS acknowledges the receipt of the Supplier Nominated Annual Consumption data.

interfaces.name: Supplier to SDS - Off-Peak Declaration
interfaces.context: The Supplier provides the SDS with a declaration of off-peak consumption for a specific day. This is used by the SDS for settlement purposes.

interfaces.name: SDS to Supplier - Off-Peak Declaration Acknowledgement
interfaces.context: The SDS acknowledges the receipt of the Off-Peak Declaration from the Supplier.

interfaces.name: Supplier to SDS - Consumption Amendment
interfaces.context: The Supplier sends a request to the SDS to amend consumption data for a specific period. This is used to correct previously submitted data.

interfaces.name: SDS to Supplier - Consumption Amendment Acknowledgment
interfaces.context: The SDS acknowledges the receipt of a Consumption Amendment request from the Supplier.

interfaces.name: Supplier to Registration Service - Linked MPAN Relationship Request
interfaces.context: The Supplier sends a request to the Registration Service to establish or update a Linked MPAN relationship. This is typically used for import/export pairs.

composition.title: B090 - MPAN Relationship Subsidiary MPAN (Conditionally Mandatory)

interfaces.name: Registration Service to Supplier - Linked MPAN Relationship Update
interfaces.context: The Registration Service notifies the Supplier of an update to a Linked MPAN relationship. This could be due to a new relationship being established or an existing one being terminated.

composition.title: B090 - MPAN Relationship Subsidiary MPAN (Conditionally Mandatory)

interfaces.name: Supplier to Registration Service - Related MPAN Relationship Request
interfaces.context: The Supplier sends a request to the Registration Service to establish or update a Related MPAN relationship.

composition.title: B090 - MPAN Relationship Subsidiary MPAN (Conditionally Mandatory)

interfaces.name: Registration Service to Supplier - Related MPAN Relationship Update
interfaces.context: The Registration Service notifies the Supplier of an update to a Related MPAN relationship. This could be due to a new relationship being established or an existing one being terminated.

composition.title: B090 - MPAN Relationship Subsidiary MPAN (Conditionally Mandatory)

interfaces.name: SDS to MDR - SDS Nominated MDR Update
interfaces.context: The SDS notifies the MDR that it has been nominated by the SDS for a particular MPAN.

interfaces.name: MDR to SDS - SDS Nominated MDR Update Response
interfaces.context: The MDR confirms that it has received the notification from the SDS regarding its nomination for a particular MPAN.

interfaces.name: SDS to MDR - SDS Assigned MDR Update
interfaces.context: The SDS notifies the MDR that it has been assigned by the DCC as the official MDR for a particular MPAN.

interfaces.name: MDR to SDS - SDS Assigned MDR Update Response
interfaces.context: The MDR confirms that it has received the notification from the SDS regarding its assignment as the official MDR for a particular MPAN.

interfaces.name: MDR to SDS - Meter Data Retrieval
interfaces.context: MDR Provide Meter Reading(s) to SDS

interfaces.name: SDS to MDR - Meter Data Retrieval Acknowledgement
interfaces.context: The SDS acknowledges the receipt of Meter Reading(s) from the MDR.

interfaces.name: DCC to SDS - DCC MDR Outcome
interfaces.context: The DCC provides an outcome from a previous MDR Appointment/De-Appointment request that the SDS submitted to them.

interfaces.name: SDS to DCC - DCC MDR Outcome Acknowledgment
interfaces.context: The SDS acknowledges the receipt of the DCC MDR Outcome from the DCC.

interfaces.name: Registration Service to Supplier - Customer Direct Contract Update Notification
interfaces.context: The Registration Service provides the Supplier with updated information about a Customer Direct Contract for an MPAN they are responsible for.

composition.title: B020 - Customer Direct Contract MS Info (Conditionally Mandatory)
B021 - Customer Direct Contract DS Info (Conditionally Mandatory)

interfaces.name: Supplier to Registration Service - Customer Direct Contract Update Acknowledgement
interfaces.context: The Supplier acknowledges the receipt of updated Customer Direct Contract information from the Registration Service.

interfaces.name: Supplier to MDR - Meter Reading Request
interfaces.context: The Supplier requests a Meter Reading(s) from a particular MDR for a particular Meter. This could be for a specific date or a series of dates.

composition.title: Mandatory to provide either a B064 Block or B065 Block
Conditionally Mandatory to provide a B083, B084 or B077 Block with Event Type [ReadingOnDemand]

composition.titleOverride: * B083 - MDR End Date (Conditionally Mandatory for [ReadingOnDemand])

composition.title: B084 Block Below Repeated for each Settlement Period(s) requested for each Meter

composition.titleOverride: * B084 - MDR Settlement Period Consumption Data (Conditionally Mandatory for [ReadingOnDemand])
* B077- MDR Request Reference Date (Conditionally Mandatory for [ReadingOnDemand])

interfaces.name: MDR to Supplier - Meter Reading Request Acknowledgment
interfaces.context: The MDR acknowledges the receipt of a Meter Reading(s) request from the Supplier.

interfaces.name: Registration Service to Supplier - Assumed Annual Consumption Update
interfaces.context: The Registration Service provides the Supplier with updated Assumed Annual Consumption data for an MPAN they are responsible for.

interfaces.name: Supplier to Registration Service - Assumed Annual Consumption Update Acknowledgement
interfaces.context: The Supplier acknowledges the receipt of updated Assumed Annual Consumption data from the Registration Service.

interfaces.name: Registration Service to Publications Service - Publication of Standing Data
interfaces.context: The Registration Service sends updated industry standing data to the Publications Service. This data is then made available to all market participants.
